linefit

Class ScientificNotation

  • java.lang.Object
    • linefit.ScientificNotation

  • public class ScientificNotation
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains helper functions that converts numbers as doubles to a string in scientific notation. Note: In the examples in the functions, the following convention is used:
    • a = number
    • b = error
    • n = power
    Also, the functions round relative to the decimal place. If roundTo is negative it will round to the left of the decimal point
    Since:
    <0.98.0
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Keith Rice

    • Method Detail

      • withError

        public static java.lang.String withError(double number,
                                         double error,
                                         int roundTo)
        Converts the number (double) with the given error value (double) into scientific notation, rounded to the given decimal place (relative to the decimal point) using ASCII characters. Returns in the form: (a ± b)×10^n
        Parameters:
        number - The number to be converted to scientific notation and rounded
        error - The error or uncertainty that is associated with the number to be put in scientific notation
        roundTo - The decimal places after the decimal point to round to (negative rounds to the right of the decimal)
        Returns:
        Returns an ASCII String the number with the given error in scientific notation rounded to the given decimal place in the following form: (a ± b)×10^n

      • withError

        public static java.lang.String withError(double number,
                                         double error,
                                         int power,
                                         int roundTo)
        Converts the number (double) with the given error value (double) into scientific notation with the ten to the given power, rounded to the given decimal place (relative to the decimal point) using ASCII characters. Returns in the form: (a ± b)×10^n
        Parameters:
        number - The number to be converted to scientific notation and rounded
        error - The error or uncertainty that is associated with the number to be put in scientific notation
        power - The power to use for ^n in scientific notation
        roundTo - The decimal places after the decimal point to round to (negative rounds to the right of the decimal)
        Returns:
        Returns an ASCII String of the number with the given error in scientific notation rounded to the given decimal place in the following form: (a ± b)×10^n

      • laTexWithError

        public static java.lang.String laTexWithError(double number,
                                              double error,
                                              int roundTo)
        Converts the number (double) with the given error value (double) into scientific notation, rounded to the given decimal place (relative to the decimal point) for use in LaTex. Returns in LaTex in the form: (a ± b)×10^n
        Parameters:
        number - The number to be converted to scientific notation and rounded
        error - The error or uncertainty that is associated with the number to be put in scientific notation
        roundTo - The decimal places after the decimal point to round to (negative rounds to the right of the decimal)
        Returns:
        Returns a string formatted for use in LaTex of the number with the given error in scientific notation rounded to the given decimal place in the following form: (a ± b)×10^n

      • laTexWithError

        public static java.lang.String laTexWithError(double number,
                                              double error,
                                              int power,
                                              int roundTo)
        Converts the number (double) with the given error value (double) into scientific notation with the ten to the given power, rounded to the given decimal place (relative to the decimal point) for use in LaTex. Returns in LaTex in the form: (a ± b)×10^n
        Parameters:
        number - The number to be converted to scientific notation and rounded
        error - The error or uncertainty that is associated with the number to be put in scientific notation
        power - The power to use for ^n in scientific notation
        roundTo - The decimal places after the decimal point to round to (negative rounds to the right of the decimal)
        Returns:
        Returns a string formatted for use in LaTex of the number with the given error in scientific notation and the given power rounded to the given decimal place in the following form: (a ± b)×10^n

      • withNoError

        public static java.lang.String withNoError(double number,
                                           int power,
                                           int roundTo)
        Converts the number (double) with no associated error/uncertainty value into scientific notation with the ten to the given power, rounded to the given decimal place (relative to the decimal point) using ASCII characters. Returns in LaTex in the form: a×10^n
        Parameters:
        number - The number to be converted to scientific notation and rounded
        power - The power to use for ^n in scientific notation
        roundTo - The decimal places after the decimal point to round to (negative rounds to the right of the decimal)
        Returns:
        Returns an ASCII string of the number in scientific notation with the given power rounded to the given decimal place in the following form: a×10^n

      • WithNoErrorAndZeroPower

        public static java.lang.String WithNoErrorAndZeroPower(double number)
        Converts the number (double) with no associated error/uncertainty and with no times ten to a power. This prevents the conversion to a string from having an 'E' or x10 in it Returns in the form: a
        Parameters:
        number - The number (double) to convert into a string
        Returns:
        The number as a string with no power and no error

      • withoutTimesTen

        public static java.lang.String withoutTimesTen(double number,
                                               int roundTo)
        Converts the number into scientific notation, but only returns the base number part of it without its power Return in the form: a
        Parameters:
        number - The number to be converted to scientific notation and rounded
        roundTo - The decimal places after the decimal point to round to (negative rounds to the right of the decimal)
        Returns:
        Returns the number without the times ten component

      • withoutTimesTen

        public static java.lang.String withoutTimesTen(double number,
                                               int power,
                                               int roundTo)
        Converts the number into scientific notation with the given power, but only returns the base number part of it without its power Return in the form: a
        Parameters:

        power - The power to use for ^n in scientific notation
        roundTo - The decimal places after the decimal point to round to (negative rounds to the right of the decimal)
        Returns:
        Returns the number without the times ten component

        Returns:

      • roundTo

        public static java.lang.String roundTo(java.lang.String numStr,
                                       int decimalsToRoundTo)
        Rounds a number (in string form) to a specified number of places, which is centered on the decimal place e.g. 1 = tenths place, 3 = thousandths place e.g. -1 = tens place, -3 = thousands place
        Parameters:
        numStr - The number to round in string form
        decimalsToRoundTo - The place to round the number to relative to the decimal point
        Returns:
        Returns the number in string format that has been rounded
